bioghist.p: Clarence Wanton Balis (1906-1993) was chairman of the Board of Directors of the Philadelphia Orchestra. Balis was the founder of Bails & Company, a Philadelphia reinsurance brokerage.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 34 1/4 inch reel-to-reel tapes of the Philadelphia Orchestra, recorded between 1955 and 1987. Most of the performances were conducted by Eugene Ormandy, but there are several conducted by others, including Ricardo Muti, Leopold Stokowski, and Robert Shaw. Soloists include Jascha Heifitz, Emanuel Feuermann, Rudolf Serkin, and Sviatoslav Richter. There is also a four tape series of the 1961 Dag Hammarskjold Memorial Concert. Most of the recordings are airchecks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
